title: Training Data Poisoning
description: Training data poisoning occurs when malicious data is introduced into the training dataset, causing the model to produce biased or malicious outputs. This can happen through injection of malicious examples, bias introduction through data manipulation, or compromised training data sources.
detection_patterns: Training data contains user-generated content without sanitization
Third-party data sources integrated without review
attack_vectors: Injection of malicious examples into training data
Backdoor insertion via poisoned training samples

mitigations.implementation: Implement data validation pipelines with quality checks, anomaly detection, and content filtering. Verify data sources and maintain data provenance.

mitigations.description: Verify and trust training data sources
mitigations.implementation: Use trusted data sources, implement data source verification, and maintain data lineage tracking.

mitigations.description: Detect and mitigate bias in training data
mitigations.implementation: Implement bias detection tools and regular audits of training data for fairness and representativeness.

references.title: OWASP LLM Top 10 - LLM03: Training Data Poisoning
